This API is intended to be run on scanned documents. Note: for free tier API keys, it is required to add a credit card to your account for security reasons, to use the free tier key with this API.

data.current_summary: Convert a photo of a document into text
data.current_description: Converts an uploaded photo of a document in common formats such as JPEG, PNG into text via Optical Character Recognition.  This API is intended to be run on photos of documents, e.g. taken with a smartphone and supports cases where other content, such as a desk, are in the frame and the camera is crooked.  If you want to OCR a scanned image, use the image/toText API call instead as it is designed for scanned images.  Note: for free tier API keys, it is required to add a credit card to your account for security reasons, to use the free tier key with this API.
data.description_suggestion: Converts an uploaded photo of a document in common formats (JPEG, PNG) into recognized text via Optical Character Recognition. Returns an ImageToTextResponse containing the extracted text and confidence rating. Optimized for photographs taken with smartphones and supports images with extraneous content (e.g., desk background) and non-perpendicular camera angles. For scanned documents from scanners, use the image/toText API instead as it is designed for that use case. Note: Free tier API keys require a credit card on file for security purposes to use this operation.
data.reasoning: Description lacks reference to the return type (ImageToTextResponse) and confidence rating information. Added specific schema reference and clarified the return value structure for better AI agent understanding of response format.
